name: 2014:11 GDG Bergen kick-off - Material design, Startup Weekend and Android Wear
description:
The first GDG Bergen meetup, and boy do we have a lot to cover. We're starting this off by covering the most talked-about topics of this fall, and we'll hopefully get into more depth at a later meetup.

17:00 - 17:30 - Food and mingle 

17:30 - 18:30 - Material Design principles

18:30 - 19:30 - Startup Weekend

19:30 - 20:00 - Material Design on Android 

20:00 - 21:00 - Android Wear

name: What are you going to Wear for x-mas?
description:
Are you ready for what to do with your Android Wear x-mas gift? Marius Seim runs us through an Android Wear design sprint. Come and join us to listen to this merry man - with this in the bag the romjul needn't be boring! We will focus on understanding the Wear design paradigm and have fun in the process. You will be able to buy beer (liquid creativity) this time around - bring cash, no fancy plasticy moneys. See you there!

Agenda:

17:00-17:30 - Food
17:30-20:00 - Android Wear design sprint

Entrance is in the lower level doorway of the Bergen Public Library (vis a vis the flower store). You'll find us in the auditorium.
how_to_find_us: Entrance is in the lower level doorway of the Bergen Public Library (vis a vis the flower store). You'll find us in the auditorium.

name: Study Jam Android Fundamentals Bergen, Norway
description:
IMPORTANT THAT YOU READ THIS

GDG Bergen Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. 

This is an amazing opportunity, and the only one in Norway. Learn all you need to know to develop Android apps.

The first jam session is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android Fundamentals curriculum. This series will be led by certified Android facilitators and will meet once weekly for 7 weeks. 

This is a great opportunity for you to get your feet wet in Android Programming, have a support circle to help you throughout the course, as well as collect some cool swag. 

Prerequisites: This is an Advanced course intended for people with programming experience in Java or another object-oriented programming language (for example: C++, Objective C or Python). Udacity's Intro to Java is a helpful background if you're looking to refresh your Java skills. 

Attendance at all study groups will be a requirement for receiving the Google-issued badge of completion 

Must complete class pre-work before each weekly session Must have own laptop and Android device and Android Studio installed per Udacity instructions

ALL STUDENTS MUST REGISTER AT THIS SITE:

</a><a href="https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/StudyJam">https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/StudyJam

DATES

All sessions are from 17:00 to 20:00;

• Feb 4th (Stille lesesal, 2. floor)

• Feb 11th (Stille lesesal, 2. floor)

• Feb 18th (Auditorium, basement)

• March 4th (Stille lesesal, 2. floor)

• March 11th (Stille lesesal, 2. floor)

• March 18th (Auditorium, basement)

• March 25th (Stille lesesal, 2. floor)

name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam finale!
description:
Android Fundamentals har vært en ukentlig kursserie vi har kjørt siden begynnelsen av februar. Kurset er nå over, og førstkommende onsdag vil vi demonstrere de ulike prosjektene.

Alle som har gjennomført kurset få utdelt kursbevis, og vi vil kåre det beste prosjektet som vil motta en sertifisering fra Udacity.

Vi begynner kl. 17 og holder på til rundt kl. 20. Etterpå vil vi gå ut og kose oss med noe godt i glasset.

Alle er hjertelig velkomne!

Vi møtes i Stille Lesesal.

name: Codelab: Google Cast SDK
description:
Join us for a codelab where we will explore the possibilities of the Google Cast SDK. With us we will have two developers who have had their hands dirty creating a multiplayer game for Google Cast. They will talk about the features and pitfalls of Google Cast SDK, and will assist us in creating a demo Cast application.

So, please bring your computer with Android Studio installed, and up to date SDKs.

Super short notice this time (had some trouble with logistics), but we hope you will be able to make it!

name: Google I/O Extended 2015 Bergen
description:
Hello all.

Join us for a day of Google fun at the Google I/O Extended Bergen. We will be watching the keynote and there will also be other activities where you can win some fabulous prizes. There will of course be food and drinks as well. If that's not enough for you we will also be giving away free t-shirts throughout the day! It will be held in the library auditorium.

Well met!﻿

name: Firebase workshop
description:
Join us at Biblioteket for an evening of exploring Firebase through an introductory presentation followed by a codelab! Just a few things to set-up before hand to get started right away: 

- Sign-up for Firebase: http://www.firebase.com 

- Be familiar with Android/HTML/JS/CSS (you are of course welcome to come and listen even though you don't have the tech-know-how). 

Firebase is a powerful platform for your mobile and web application. Firebase can power your app’s backend, including data storage, user authentication, static hosting, and more. With Firebase, you can easily build mobile and web apps that scale from one user to one million.

And of course, bring your laptops.

name: GDG BERGEN GAME NIGHT
description:
Welcome to our game-themed night.

Fredrik Fors Hansen at DirtyBit (www.dirtybit.com) will join us to talk about their game development for Android. They have developed games like Fun Run, Fun Run 2 and Drop The Box.

Øyvind Randa will also give a demo of the Cardboard API.

name: 2015:12 X-mas meeting! Mobile banking and Android 6.0!
description:
This will be our final meeting for 2015. Our agenda is a little bit different this time.

Sparebanken Vest - mobile banking on Android

We will be introduced to the inner workings of the Android app from Sparebanken Vest. It includes points about Cordova, plugins, refreshed login dialog and much, much more. We will also touch in on Android 6.0 integration.

Android 6.0

As we continue from the previous subject, we will delve into some of the broadest changes is Android 6.0. Permission management, Fingerprint APIs, Auto-backup and more.

Maybe Santa is coming?

Perhaps there will be something to take home this time....?

We'll end the night with a trip to somewhere with good beer :-)

name: 2016:2 Introduksjon til RxJava
description:
Introduksjon til RxJava

https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/wiki

Rx er et bibliotek som lar oss håndtere strømmer av asynkrone meldinger på samme måte som streams i Java og en god vei inn i funksjonell programmering i Java.

Vi deler det opp i to deler. Der første delen blir en kort intro til Rx og litt live koding, og siste delen blir en enkel workshop der du hands on erfaring med Rx. For å delta i workshopen må du ha Java 8, git og Maven installert. Det kreves ingen forkunnskap, men det er fordel om du kjenner til Streams i Java 8.

Foredragsholder er Mads Lundeland fra Vimond Media AS.

Du tar med:

• Laptop med...

• En god IDE (anbefaler IntelliJ IDEA)
• Java8
• Maven installer

 Vi befinner oss i Stille lesesal i 2. etasje på biblioteket! Vel møtt!

name: 2016:04 Svippr og Continuous integration med Google Cloud, CircleCI og Docker
description:
Velkommen til Aprilmøtet i GDG!

Agenda:
* 17:00 - 17:15 Velkommen
* 17:15 - 18:30 Svippr - Norges beste taxiapp med Tormod Tønnesen og Marius Seim
* 18:40 - 19:40 Continuous Integration and Delivery med Google Cloud, CircleCI og Docker med Øyvind Randa
* 19:40 - 20:00 Google IO Extended

Vi starter med Tormod Tønnesen og Marius Seim fra EVRY som forteller om utviklingen av Svippr og Bergen Taxi - Norges beste taxiapp. Tormod begynner med en introduksjon til RxAndroid, og Marius fortsetter med historien bak Norges beste taxi-app, design til Android Wear og markedsføring av appen. Deretter ryktes det et lite sneak peak inn i Svippr-koden...

Nysgjerrig på hvordan du enkelt kan komme i gang med bygg og deploy av applikasjoner? Øyvind Randa vil prøve å avmystifisere noe av dette ved å gi oss en enkel gjennomgang av hvordan vi kan teste og deploye Node-applikasjoner med CircleCi, Docker og Google Cloud Services.

Vi ønsker alle hjertelig velkommen. Dere finner oss i Stille lesesal i 2. etasje på hovedbiblioteket i Bergen.

name: 2016:05 I/O Extended 2016
description:
Welcome to Google IO Extended 2016!

Brought to you by our sponsors EVRY and CapGemini who will provide food, swag, unicorns and prizes for our competition.

Join us for a day of Google fun at Google IO Extended: Bergen Edition. We will be watching the keynote and there will also be a quiz where you can win some fabulous prizes, among them a brand new 2 Gen Smartwatch from Motorola! 

There will of course be food and drinks as well. You can even get beer in the 1. floor bar! 

There are about 50 t-shirts up for grabs, so be there early. It will be held in UROM at the public library.

Agenda:

• 18:00 Doors open and delicious food
• 19:00 Google IO 2016 Keynote
• 21:00 Kahoot quiz with prizes
• 21-23 Drinks in the bar 

Well met!

name: 2016:06 Sommermøte! FotMob og Google I/O
description:
Velkommen til Google Developers Group Bergen sitt sommermøte. I disse EM-tider passer det perfekt å få besøk av NorApps! NorApps utvikler fotballappen FotMob som har over 10 millioner nedlastninger og er topp 10 i alle de største fotballnasjonene verden rundt. Roy Solberg kommer på besøk og vil fortelle om hvordan fotballeventyret ble til og gi en kort innføring i hvordan Android-appen er bygd opp. Roy jobber som lead Android-utvikler hos NorApps og har lang fartstid fra konsulentbransjen med fokus på mobilteknologi.

For alle som gikk glipp av Google I/O i år så vil Håkon Nilsen gi en oppsummering av de viktigste nyhetene fra Google og hvilke muligheter det gir for utviklere og brukere av Google-teknologi.

Etter eventen tar vi sikte på å stikke på utescenen for å se Italia-Irland. Dersom været ikke tillater det kan vi prøve å finne plass på Fotballpuben.

Vel møtt!

name: Mobile Developer Evening with Google Expert Erik Hellman
description:
There will be food and drinks from 18:00 until the talk start 18:30.

RSVP here for food tickets

Topics of the evening:

- Clean Architecture

- RxJava with MVP and MVVM

- Implementing Material Design

Meet Erik Hellman:

A software developer with 20 years of experience, ranging from large scale telecom, enterprise, web, mobile, and embedded/IoT programming. Erik is an early adopter of new technologies and a big proponent of automated tests and test-driven development. He can often be found speaking at conferences around the world and has also written a book on Android development (Android Programming: Pushing the Limits). He is currently working as a freelancing software developer, focusing on Android, Cloud and IoT, and has previously worked at companies like Ericsson, Sony Mobile and Spotify.

name: Live stream Chrome Dev Summit Keynote & Progressive Web Apps talk
description:
Welcome to Google Developer Group Bergen November meetup at Nyskapingsparken. This will be a pre-event for the Global Entrepreneurship Week that will start 14.10 and last until 20.10. Check out more details here

This time we are streaming live from Chrome Dev Summit! We get an introduction to a really exciting topic Progressive Web Apps (Topic for future meetup TBA) and the state of Chrome.

Agenda:

•  18:30 - Food and drinks: sponsored by LosTacos (lostacos.no)

• 19:00 - Keynote

Darin Fisher, VP, Chrome Engineering

The state of Chrome and the Web Platform today, from the leader of the Chrome team.

• 19:30 - Building Progressive Web Apps Today

Thao Tran, Strategic Partner Development Manager

Progressive Web Apps are all about improving your user experience. Thao shares some success stories and gives some guidance.

• 20:00 - TBA / drinks at Lysverket

See you there!

name: Google HashCode Bergen
description:
MELD DEG PÅ HER:
https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html

Universitetet i Bergen og GDG Bergen inviterer til Google HashCode 2017. Beste bidrag blir belønnet med en billett til Booster 15.-17. mars.

HashCode er en konkurranse hvor du melder på ditt team som skal klare å løse et konkret problem sammen med tusenvis av andre lag. Problemet er konkret og basert i et virkelig behov. De teamene som leverer de mest lovende leveransene vil bli trukket ut til å delta på finalerunden i Paris i april i år.

Vi arrangerer dette på Høgteknologisenteret, og det vil bli mat og drikke. Du har anledning til å ta med medbragt øl hvis du ønsker det (ingen ølsalg).

Studenter oppfordres spesielt til å melde seg på.

Bergens beste konferanse, Booster, sponser én billett til konferansen 15.-17. mars til en verdi av ca. 8 000kr.

name: Google Cloud NEXT Extended
description:
https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/

Google Cloud NEXT er Googles største konferanse, og er fullspekket med forelesninger om Cloud, TensorFlow, maskinlæring og alt annet som er kult.

Vi inviterer deg til vårt visning, kom og se keynoten sammen med oss. Vi vil ha swag, mat og drikke! Husk å RSVP'e sånn at vi bestiller riktig mengde mat.

Etter keynoten vil Hans Kristian Flaatten fra EVRY fortelle oss om Kubernetes; motoren bak Google Cloud og Google sine datasentre som gjør containere brukbare i storskala drift. 

Agenda:

• 17:30 - 18:00 Velkommen - mat og drikke serveres

• 18:00 - 19:30 Google NEXT Keynote

• 19:30 - 20:30 Hans Kristian Flaatten (EVRY): Kubernetes

• 20:30 - 21:00 Q&A, takk for nå.

Ring[masked] så blir du hentet i hovedinngangen.

name: GDGpils
description:
Vil du diskutere Android, cloud, web, osv over en øl så er du velkommen til å bli med oss på TempoTempo!

Vel møtt!

PS: Opprinnelig plan var å møtes for å grille, men pga været har vi valgt å utsette dette til en annen gang.

name: Kubernetes workshop, lær å bruke Docker i prod!
description:
Denne gangen får vi besøk av Hans Kristian Flaatten fra Evry (hovedsponsor) som skal holde en Kubernetes workshop for oss!

Kubernetes workshoppen gir en hands on introduksjon for de som ikke har brukt det før. Her lærer dere å sette opp, kjøre, administrere, og oppdatere applikasjoner på Kubernetes-plattformen. Basic container / Docker kunnskaper er å anbefale, men er ikke avgjørende for å få utbytte av workshoppen. Vi begynner med en kort introduksjon av Kubernetes sine kjerne-konsepter før vi setter i gang.

Det er viktig at alle deltakerne har med egne maskiner som har Kubernetes kjørende slik at vi ikke trenger å bruke for mye tid på å sette dette opp underveis. Instruksjoner for oppsett av Kubernetes på lokal maskin ligger her:
https://github.com/evry-bergen/kubernetes-workshop

Hans Kristian er Senior Consultant DevOps hos EVRY Norge hvor han hjelper bedrifter og organisasjoner med å oppnå maksimalt utbytte av DevOps, blant annet ved å sette opp en automatisert software delivery pipeline i tillegg til nødvendige infrastrukturendringer. Han har spesialisert seg på container management, deployment og arkitektur.

Han er også evangelist for Open Source og Åpne Data, i tillegg til å være en veldig aktiv medlem av Node.js Foundation hvor han administrerer test og release av offisielle Node.js-versjoner og det offisielle Docker-imaget for Node.js

Agenda:
- Kort om EVRY (hovedsponsor) (17:00 - 17:10)
- Mat og drikke (17:15 - 17:45)
- Kubernetes workshop (17:45 - 20:30)
- Oppsummering / spørsmål / diskusjon (20:30 - 21:00)

Stor takk til EVRY som er hovedsponsor i kveld!

name: Google Developer Group Bergen og Bergen Machine Learning inviterer.
description:
13. Juni arrangerer vi sammen med Bergen Machine Learning en felles Meetup før sommeren.

Vi er så heldige å få besøk av Googler Andres L. Martinez-Ortiz. Han er leder for flere av Googles utviklingsteam i Europa og en erfaren foredragsholder.

Fra UIB kommer Julius Parulek som er Adjunct Associate Professor og softwareutvikler i Metas.

Vi møtes kl 17.00 til lett servering og mingling før programmet begynner.

Program:

17.00 - Start

17.15 - Curating Online Content with Google ML / Andres L. Martinez-Ortiz (Almo)

18.00 - Pause

18.15 - Data analysis, Visualization and Machine Learning / Julius Parulek

19.00 - Avsluttning.

Dette blir en kveld med interessante foredrag og uformell tone!

name: 2017 08: Kotlin - Introduksjon og workshop
description:
Kotlin er et programmeringsspråk utviklet av JetBrains (folkene bak IntelliJ, Resharper osv). Språket ble sidestilt med Java som førsteklasses plattformspråk for Android under Google IO 2017. 

Torstein Skulbru, team lead mobility i EVRY Bergen, gir en introduksjon til Kotlins spennende og intrikate syntaks. Deretter fortsetter kvelden med praktiske oppgaver slik at alle får teste ut hvordan Kotlin sitter i fingrene.

Ha med:

• PC eller mac

• Siste versjon av Intellij Community Edition eller Android Studio (oppdateringer må gjøres før workshop)

• Godt humør!

Agenda

17:00 - Oppmøte og mat
17:30 - Introduksjon av Torstein Skulbru
18:00 - Workshop
20:00 - Vi runder av

Lokasjon: TV 2, Nøstet (Ring[masked] om ingen åpner døren)

name: Introduction to Deep Learning with Keras and Tensorflow
description:
• What we'll do
Neural Networks are becoming very popular lately with the rise of Deep Learning. In this session we will dive into how we build basic networks to more advanced concepts with Keras .

Keras is a high-level neural network API written in Python and are capable of running on top of Tensorflow, CNTK or Theano. For this workshop we will use Keras with a Tensorflow backend. In this workshop we will build a simple image classifier and some other awesome stuff. Agenda:
17:00-17:30 - Meet and greet
17:30-18:15 - Presentation of Neural Networks
18:15-20:00 - Build Neural Networks yourself.

• What to bring
- Computer with docker installed.
how_to_find_us: Gå inn i Media City Bergen og finn tårn 3 som ligger innenfor spiseområdene. Dersom døren er lukket kan du ringe nummeret som står på inngangsdøren, og noen vil hente deg.

name: Hacking av webapper med Roy Solberg
description:
• What we'll do
Det har vært et sterkt fokus på informasjonssikkerhet i IT-mediene den siste tiden, og Roy Solberg må ta en del av æren for det. Han har den siste tiden avdekket alvorlige sikkerhetshull i Skandiabanken (Sbanken), InfoTorg, og ikke minst skandalen rundt sporingsklokker for barn som f.eks. Gator. Hans fremgangsmåte er rasjonell, og bunner først og fremst ned i nysgjerrighet; hvilke kall gjør tjenesten, hvorfor gjør det slike kall, kan jeg manipulere kallene for å hente ut andre data enn mine egne.

Han vil gi en introduksjon til metode og fremgangsmåte, samt gjøre en liten live-demo sammen med oss. Vi avslutter kvelden med noen hands on-øvelser. Ta med PC eller Mac. Det holder å ha Chrome installert, men cURL, og programmer som Fiddler og Charles kan også brukes hvis du er komfortabel med dem.

Roy Solberg jobber til daglig som mobiluvikler i NorApps AS. Der jobber han med en av verdens mest populære fotball-apper - FotMob. Han har tidligere jobbet 10 år som IT-konsulent i Bergen.

Agenda:
17:00 - 17:30 - Velkommen. Vi spiser og koser oss
17:30 - 17:35 - Informasjon fra Google Developer Group Bergen
17:35 - 18:30 - Roy Solberg holder foredrag om forbrukersikkerhet
18:45 - 20:00 - Hands on-øvelser

Array AS er stolt sponsor av denne eventen.

Linker til noen av sakene fra Roy Solberg:
https://blog.roysolberg.com/

https://www.digi.no/artikler/norsk-mobilapp-apnet-for-tapping-av-masse-informasjon-om-norske-bileiere/400386

https://www.digi.no/artikler/saldoen-til-kontoer-hos-skandiabanken-var-tilgjengelig-for-andre-kunder/405568

https://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/10/18/child_smartwatch_privacy_peril/

• What to bring
Skal du være med på hands on-øvelsene så tar du med PC eller Mac. Ha Chrome installert. Om du er komfortabel med mer avanserte verktøy vil Fiddler, Charles proxy og cURL være lurt å ha installert.

• Important to know
Det blir mat og drikke for de som melder seg på. Vennligst gi tidlig beskjed om eventuelle allergier eller lignende til styret (a) gdgbergen.no
how_to_find_us: Gå inn inngangen fra Lars Hilles gate, ta mot høyre gjennom restaurantområdet. Gå inn døren markert med et stort 3-tall. Heis opp til 8. etasje.

name: Cloud Study Jam - Google Cloud Essentials and Kubernetes
description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin or you have experience with the platform

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam with our good friends in DevOps Bergen! Together we'll work through Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs and Kubernetes labs. Don't worry if you haven't had any experience with GCP or Kubernetes. We need start from the beginning.

If you can't finish during the meetup you will have plenty of time to finish at home and if you finish one quest of labs you will receive a Google Hosted badge for your online profile. You will also be able to finish any of the other labs on your own. Everyone that joins the meetup with get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know

name: Hash Code
description:
Hash Code is a team-based programming competition organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem for you to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be notified on 28th February 2017 and invited to the Final Round at Google Paris!

What do I need to participate?
IMPORTANT!!! Everyone that wants to participate must register at https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/ before the 26th of Febuary 18:00 CET.

If you dont have a team just sign up and we will help you form a team before the deadline for forming teams at 18:30 CET 1th of March.

What do bring?
Bring our own laptop

Agenda:

• 17:30:Doors open and pizza will be served. (If you have any food preference or allergies let us know.)

• 18:30:Live stream starts

• 19:45: Competition starts

• 22:30:End of the competition

More info on https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/

name: Build Actions for your Community - Building conversational chatbots
description:
Welcome to meetup about Google on Action and Dialogflow in collaboration with NCE Media! This meetup will be in the Media Lab in tower 3 on 9th floor.

The entrance to tower 3 is located at the other end of the building from the main entrance – after passing the restaurant area. There you will be met by someone from NCE Media/GDG who can let you into the secured zone. Arriving after 17:10 there is a number on the door you can call to have someone come and let you in.

Agenda:
In the first part, Hans Petter will give you an overview of how to create apps for Google Assistant (and more!) using Dialogflow (www.dialogflow.com) and Actions on Google (https://developers.google.com/actions/).

Topics to be covered:
- What it is and why it matters
- Making the move from graphical user interfaces (GUI) to conversational user interfaces (CUI)
- Doing intent matching and entity extraction in Dialogflow
- Tying Dialogflow to an external data source
- Tying Dialogflow to Actions on Google
- Publishing your Actions on Google app

In the second part we’ll use what we learned in the first part to build an Assistant app.

About Hans Petter Eide:
Hans Petter is a freelance developer living in Oslo. He’s currently hired by NRK, where he’s working on the NRK Super childrens app for Android, and have previously worked with clients like Urban Sharing (Oslo City Bike, Bergen City Bike..), Cisco and FINN.

There will be pizza served at 17:00 and the lecture will start at 17:30.

Please let us know if you have any food intolerances.
how_to_find_us: You can find us at the enterance to tower 3. If you arrive late please call the number on the door and someone will come and get you.

name: Google IO Extended 2018 Bergen
description:
Welcome to Google IO Extended 2018!

Are you interested in technology and wonder what Google will come up with next?

Join us for a day of Google fun at Google IO Extended. We will be watching the keynote and there will also be a quiz where you can win some fabulous prizes!

There will of course be food and drinks as well, and you can buy beer in the bar.

There are limited t-shirts up for grabs, so be there early.

All this is possible because of our fantastic sponsor Apparat AS.

Agenda:

• 18:00 Doors open and delicious food
• 18:20 Keynote Preshow starts
• 19:00 Google IO 2018 Keynote
• 21:00 Kahoot quiz with prizes
• 21:30-23 Drinks in the bar

Well met!

name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
Do you want to learn how to write blazing fast cross platform mobile apps? or you are looking for a alternative for React Native ? Then join use for a fun evening where we explore Flutter.

What is Flutter ?

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

What will you learn ?

We will follow the Udacity Flutter course that is made by Google. We will work through as much as possible of the first part of the course so you will have a good understanding of Flutter going forward.

What to bring ?
Bring a laptop. Flutter require some downloading if you haven't done any mobile development before so try to install flutter before you come so we don't loose time on installing. If you have any problems with the setup we will gladly help you get everything running.

Agenda :
17:30 - Food
18:00 - Intro about Flutter and key concepts
18:30 - Work on Flutter code labs
20:30 - Beer!

Links :
Udacity course : https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905
Flutter : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

If you have any allergies or intolerances please let us know so we can order food for you.

Welcome!

name: Firebase using Cloud Firestore and Cloud Functions workshop with Googlers
description:
In collaboration with NorApps and Apparat we are proud to present Firebase workshop with Googlers from the Firebase team. The session will be lead by:

Susan Goldblatt

Susan Goldblatt is a Software Engineer at Google. She works on Firebase as a front end developer. Before Google, she wrote a computer science curriculum for high schoolers and worked at a startup in NYC.

Lauren Long

Lauren is a Tech Lead on the Firebase Team at Google San Francisco. Prior to joining Google, Lauren co-founded the storage-on-demand startup Boxit, and was the first Product Manager at wearable tech company Nymi. Lauren has spoken internationally about entrepreneurship and technology. In her spare time, she enjoys swing dancing, rock climbing, and writing.

They will take us through building an app using Firebase, and how it takes care of data storage, synchronization, file storage, authentication, and other backend functionality so that your time can be spent polishing user interactions. In this codelab you will build a Firestore-backend restaurant recommendation web app.

You will learn how to:

- Listen to changes in Firestore data in realtime
- Use Firebase Authentication and security rules to secure Firestore data
- Write complex Firestore queries
- Integrate with cloud Functions

Agenda
17:00 - Doors open
17:15 - Food and swag
17:45 - Word from our sponsors
18:00 - Presentation and codelab starts
19:30 - QA
19:45 - Kahoot with prizes
20:00 - Beer time!

If you have any food allergies or intolerances, please notify us in advance.
how_to_find_us: Go left by the main door and follow the signs.

name: An introduction to Go
description:
Join us for an introduction to Google's
increasingly popular programming language Go.

This workshop will walk you through the absolute basics
of Go; what it is, what you can do with it,
how the syntax is, what's in the standard library.
We will also dive a little deeper into some concepts
where Go differs from the rest of the crowd
and finally we'll finish with some hands on
tutorials where you can try out Go for yourself.

Prerequisites

- Bring a laptop.
- Make sure you have an editor or IDE you're
comfortable with. VS Code or IntelliJ are good options.
- Git and a browser are also nice to have.
- Be at least somewhat comfortable with using a terminal.

If you're feeling adventurous install Go and set it
up following these directions: https://golang.org/doc/install

Agenda
17:30 - Food and networking
18:00 - An introduction to Go
20:00 - Beer at place to be named later!

Please let us know if you haver any allergies or intolerance so we can order food for you.
how_to_find_us: Entrence is the door to the left of Cafe Viken.

name: Google Cloud Night!  Google Kubernetes Engine & Creating Google Assistant bot
description:
We are getting visitors from Google Oslo! This meetup will have parallell talks so there will be something for everyone!

Talk.1 :

Creating a bot using DialogFlow and Firebase for Google Assistant by Usman Ali, Google Cloud Architect.

This GDG for Dialogflow + Firebase + Actions on Google (AOG) is suitable for all levels including beginners and is open for everyone interested in bot creation. By using DialogFlow and Firebase, we can make our actions creation process easier and faster. They are accessible, responsive, contextually aware and can be easily integrated with number of different channels.

The use of machine learning, voice recognition and Artificial intelligence is simplified and you can focus on creating the best experience to engage your users as well as enable other parts of google cloud to further enhance and personalize your customer experience

Prerequisites:
Laptop and it’s recommended to do following Codelab :
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/actions-1/

Talk.2 :

Google Kubernetes Engine - The easiest way to run your kubernetes workloads by Per Anders Jørgensen, Google Cloud Architect.

This workshop is for anyone interested in modernize their applications using Microservices. We will give a short intro to Kubernetes concepts and architecture before we look into the easiest way to run your container workloads using Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). You will also be able to try it out for yourself doing a hands-on lab where you will create your own Kubernetes cluster and deploy a simple app.

If we have time we will also briefly spend some time on our Istio support. We truly believe that Istio will play a key role in helping you make the most of your microservices. With Istio on GKE, we are the first major cloud provider to offer direct integration to a Kubernetes service and simplified lifecycle management for your containers.

Prerequisites:
Basic understanding of docker and containerization is recommended.
To do the labs you will need a Laptop and access to a GCP account. You can sign up for a trial here: https://cloud.google.com/free/

Agenda for the night

17:00 - Food
17:30 - Google Assistant & GKE talk starts
19:30 - Finished for the evening

If you have any allergies or intolerances please let us know so we can order food for you.

name: Hash Code 2019
description:
Together with University of Bergen we would like to welcome you to Hash Code 2019.
Hash Code is a team-based programming competition organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem for you to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

We have prices for the best scoring teams of the night plus some other secret awards.

What do I need to participate?
IMPORTANT!!! Everyone that wants to participate must register at https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode by 27th of February.

If you dont have a team just sign up and form a dummy team and we will put you together with someone

What do bring?
Bring our own laptop

Agenda:

• 17:30:Doors open and pizza will be served. (If you have any food preference or allergies let us know.)
• 18:30:Live stream starts
• 19:45: Competition starts
• 22:30:End of the competition
• 22:45:Prize ceremony

More info on https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode
how_to_find_us: There will be a sign in the door
